channel.title: Quote
channel.description:
It is the quality of one's convictions that determines success, not the number of followers.
By Professor Lupos (In english it's Lupin). Harry Potter's teacher in the third movie. I personally like this statement. It sounds let's say cool? And i'm also thinking this might be true if the followers are not with 10x as much for example. I like to know your opinion on this. What do you think about this. Do you like it? Why (not)? Do you think it's true? Discuss.

item.title: Quote
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

Slade (Of Teen Titans):

I am the thing that keeps you up at night, the evil that haunts every dark corner of your mind… I will never rest. And neither will you…

Robin (Of Teen Titans):

There is good and there is evil. There are those who commit crimes and those who stop them. The two sides are opposite, as different as day and night. And the line between them is clear. Or at least it’s supposed to be.

Beast Boy (Of Teen Titans):

I may not be smart enough to do everything, but I’m dumb enough to try anything.

Red Star (Of Teen Titans):

There is a power inside of me… I cannot control it.

If you look at the place/show I got it from, I was doing bored browsing so I happened to drop into the show I used to love, Teen Titans.

Read full topic
